The fact that some people play the game for free has absolutely no bearing on this discussion: This is an event that affects people who pay money, and no one else; the only people complaining are paying customers. Bringing up that *other* people might play the game for free is completely irrelevant, so I don't see why it would be brought up at all unless it was being used as some kind of excuse.

It's NOT a free service. This is a business which is funded by transactions. The fact that the payment model allows lower-level free service (even if that low level happens to be rather high in this case) doesn't change that. A paying customer has every right to complain about services involving payment. The free content has no bearing on that.

Of course if people don't want to spend the money, they shouldn't complain, but that's exactly the problem: EVERYONE HERE WANTS TO SPEND MONEY. We all love the game, we all love the free and the paid content, and we want to play it more and buy more content. Customer service complaints are never matters of people who don't want to be customers; they're matters of people who DO want to be customers, but don't feel they're being treated well.

And I wouldn't even care if it WAS pay to play. I bought Awesomenauts -- another MOBA -- which requires money to play, and I bought the expansion, AND I bought tons of skins that weren't even free with a paid copy. And had I known about the kickstarter for the expansion when it was up, I probably would have helped fund it too, because I wanted to play the game.

Difference between Awesomenauts (via Steam) and what's going on here with League, is that Steam does its savings events DURING Christmas, not after. I bought tons of Awesomenauts skin for lower prices during that event (since Steam doesn't use a points system, just direct money transactions, the pricing is the best parallel) with no issue and no complaint, and I know DotA 2, one of League's biggest competitors, did the same thing though I didn't buy anything from that game.

That's an example of two of League's competitors doing better customer service, so Riot should take notice.

Promotions are NOT really free. "Buy 1 get 1 free" encourages SALES. Getting a tiny smidgen of bonus RP for paying real money encourages SALES. Even in cases of legitimately free content (not just better-value content like this is), the goal is to make money, not to be Santa Klaus.

This announcement was not only heavily thought about but also planned well in advance of the holiday season.  What Riot is doing is the exact same thing nearly all retail companies do every year.  It is a sound business practice to provide incentives during low/off seasons to boost sales.  Riot made a ton of money during xmas that is for sure but since everyone bought everything they wanted this month that means Riots gross revenue is going to suffer for Q1 of 2015.  They did absolutely nothing wrong by posting this when they did, in fact, as a business man and professional I applaud Riot for this tactic.  They are going to maintain a stable income/growth rate well into the new year with this promotion and as someone who didn't even get any RP for Xmas I will be the first to take advantage of it.  Refusing to refund people for purchases made prior to this is also a sound and smart idea on their part because essentially what a vast majority of you players (children) are saying is you feel you are entitled to return your product just to buy it again at a lower price because of a promotion...  I'm sorry but that is actually considered fraud in some states.  It will cause Riot to be in a very bad spot come Q1 if they allowed it as they would lose a huge amount of their income for the previous year and would be completely counter productive from its intended purpose.

Put it this way:

1. They allow you to play the game, unlock every champion/rune/rune page for free.
2. They maintain a very high level of customer service and quality by keeping server downtime to a bare minimum if any.
3. They don't harass you with advertisements (like most FTP games) or make you wait in between matches or even have any limit on how much you can play at all.
4. It costs them a large amount of money to provide this service to you (FOR FREE).
5. The ONLY thing you cant get without spending real money is skins, period. 

So with everything they give us (FOR FREE) who the hell are you to demand more for less?  

You aren't forced to buy RP.
You aren't harassed to buy RP.
You don't need RP to win.
RP gives no in game advantage.

So complaining because a company that gives you a FREE game to play all you want for FREE for as long as you want simply because they are offering a discount on their RP after Xmas AND YOU didn't get to take advantage of it is so beyond immature I can't believe this argument is happening.

Good Job Riot.  
-A happy customer

Econ 101:
1. Sell at highest price during high demand (holiday season). Those who can't wait will purchase at the highest price to receive desired merchandise first (those who want it most deserves it most).

2. After all or most people willing to pay a premium have made their purchases, run a promotion/discount to entice those on the border to make purchases at lower (fair) price. Continue until sales price = manufacturing cost

3. If the desired merchandise is depreciable (becomes less valuable over time), sell the merchandise at cost (no profit).

4. When the merchandise is of no value or close to no value, sell the merchandise at a lower price to recover a portion of cost (something is better than nothing).

Follow the above four steps to insure highest profit and sales. Since League is not depreciable, only steps 1 and 2 applies. Hopefully this answers your question.
